Annotation.String: A NetworkAdapter represents the physical network adapter capable of connecting to a computer network. Examples include but are not limited to Ethernet, Fibre Channel, and converged network adapters.
A NetworkAdapter represents the physical network adapter capable of connecting to a computer network. Examples include but are not limited to Ethernet, Fibre Channel, and converged network adapters.
This action is to clear the settings back to factory defaults.
This action shall perform a reset of all active and pending settings back to factory default settings upon reset of the network adapter.
A NetworkAdapter represents the physical network adapter capable of connecting to a computer network. Examples include but are not limited to Ethernet, Fibre Channel, and converged network adapters.
A NetworkAdapter represents the physical network adapter capable of connecting to a computer network. Examples include but are not limited to Ethernet, Fibre Channel, and converged network adapters.
Contains the members of this collection.
Contains the members of this collection.
The manufacturer or OEM of this network adapter.
The value of this property shall contain a value that represents the manufacturer of the network adapter.
The model string for this network adapter.
The value of this property shall contain the information about how the manufacturer references this network adapter.
The manufacturer SKU for this network adapter.
The value of this property shall contain the Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) for the network adapter.
The serial number for this network adapter.
The value of this property shall contain the serial number for the network adapter.
Part number for this network adapter.
The value of this property shall contain the part number for the network adapter as defined by the manufacturer.
The set of network controllers ASICs that make up this NetworkAdapter.
The value of this property shall contain the set of network controllers ASICs that make up this NetworkAdapter.
The available actions for this resource.
The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
A network controller ASIC that makes up part of a NetworkAdapter.
This type shall describe a network controller ASIC that makes up part of a NetworkAdapter.
The version of the user-facing firmware package.
The value of this property shall be the version number of the user-facing firmware package.
Links for this controller.
The capabilities of this controller.
The value of this property shall contain the capabilities of this controller.
The capabilities of a controller.
This type shall describe the capabilities of a controller.
The number of physical ports on this controller.
The value of this property shall be the number of physical ports on this controller.
The maximum number of physical functions available on this controller.
The value of this property shall be the number of physical functions available on this controller.
Data Center Bridging (DCB) for this controller.
This object shall contain capability, status, and configuration values related to Data Center Bridging (DCB) for this controller.
Virtualization offload for this controller.
This object shall contain capability, status, and configuration values related to virtualization offload for this controller.
N_Port ID Virtualization (NPIV) capabilties for this controller.
This object shall contain N_Port ID Virtualization (NPIV) capabilties for this controller.
Data Center Bridging (DCB) for capabilities of a controller.
This type shall describe the capability, status, and configuration values related to Data Center Bridging (DCB) for a controller.
Whether this controller is capable of Data Center Bridging (DCB).
The value of this property shall be a boolean indicating whether this controller is capable of Data Center Bridging (DCB).
A virtual function of a controller.
This type shall describe the capability, status, and configuration values related to a virtual function for a controller.
The maximum number of Virtual Functions (VFs) supported by this controller.
The value of this property shall be the maximum number of Virtual Functions (VFs) supported by this controller.
The maximum number of Virtual Functions (VFs) supported per network port for this controller.
The value of this property shall be the maximum number of Virtual Functions (VFs) supported per network port for this controller.
The minimum number of Virtual Functions (VFs) that can be allocated or moved between physical functions for this controller.
The value of this property shall be the minimum number of Virtual Functions (VFs) that can be allocated or moved between physical functions for this controller.
Contains references to other resources that are related to this resource.
This type, as described by the Redfish Specification, shall contain references to resources that are related to, but not contained by (subordinate to), this resource.
Contains the members of this collection.
Contains the members of this collection.
Contains the members of this collection.
Single-Root Input/Output Virtualization (SR-IOV) capabilities.
This type shall contain Single-Root Input/Output Virtualization (SR-IOV) capabilities.
Whether this controller supports Single Root Input/Output Virtualization (SR-IOV) in Virtual Ethernet Port Aggregator (VEPA) mode.
The value of this property shall be a boolean indicating whether this controller supports Single Root Input/Output Virtualization (SR-IOV) in Virtual Ethernet Port Aggregator (VEPA) mode.
A Virtualization offload capability of a controller.
This type shall describe the capability, status, and configuration values related to a virtualization offload for a controller.
Single-Root Input/Output Virtualization (SR-IOV) capabilities.
This object shall contain Single-Root Input/Output Virtualization (SR-IOV) capabilities.
N_Port ID Virtualization (NPIV) capabilties for a controller.
This type shall contain N_Port ID Virtualization (NPIV) capabilties for a controller.
The maximum number of N_Port ID Virtualization (NPIV) logins allowed simultaneously from all ports on this controller.
The value of this property shall be the maximum number of N_Port ID Virtualization (NPIV) logins allowed simultaneously from all ports on this controller.
The maximum number of N_Port ID Virtualization (NPIV) logins allowed per physical port on this controller.
The value of this property shall be the maximum number of N_Port ID Virtualization (NPIV) logins allowed per physical port on this controller.
This version was created to remove the Nullable facet on NavigationProperties of type Collection.
A reference to the Assembly resource associated with this adapter.
The value of this property shall be a link to a resource of type Assembly.
